page.title: 01DURNESS-GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: Durness is a remote rural area of Sutherland, lying some 15km east of Cape Wrath, the most north-westerly point in Great Britain. It is set against a backdrop of wild, rugged mountains and is surrounded by open, barren moors fringed with towering sea cliffs and bays of golden sand. The population of about 350 is scattered among several townships which collectively make Durness. The village presents a typical Highland scene of traditional stone built houses set in a patchwork of croft fields. The mainstays of the local economy are tourism and sheep farming. The area provides excellent tourist facilities and is ideal for those who wish to walk,mountaineer,fish,sail,study plants and birds or simply wish to enjoy the peace and quiet.
